money_sign.money_sign_desc: You have a striking demeanour and a curious mind, which means you’re always on the lookout for the next big opportunity. Your formula for success has always been to fill the gaps in your skill set by drawing on the expertise of people in your social circle. This helps you make the most of the options presented to you, even when the window of opportunity is narrow. You’ll do what it takes to emerge ahead of your competitors. Being highly self-motivated allows you to keep exploring new pursuits no matter what the outcome may be. While taking time off to celebrate a significant milestone is important to you, you will not think twice before jumping right back into action if there’s something exciting on the horizon.

money_sign_behavioural_bias.title: Overconfidence Bias
money_sign_behavioural_bias.desc: You may, at times, exhibit unwarranted faith in your own abilities, judgements and knowledge levels, which can manifest as attributing success to your skills and failures to external factors. This bias might convince you to underestimate risks and overestimate returns, which would lead to a highly concentrated portfolio.

money_sign_behavioural_bias.title: Self-Control Bias
money_sign_behavioural_bias.desc: A lack of self-discipline for resisting the temptation to indulge in habits that provide instant gratification can hamper your progress towards achieving long-term goals. This bias could result in you falling short of achieving your financial milestones, and might even mislead you into taking undue risk to compensate for the shortfall.

money_sign_behavioural_bias.title: Loss-Aversion Bias
money_sign_behavioural_bias.desc: For you, the dissatisfaction caused by a monetary loss of a certain amount tends to be much higher than the satisfaction derived from a monetary gain of the same amount. This mindset could encourage irrational risk-taking behaviour for overcoming losses, and excessive cautiousness when dealing with gains. This bias may limit the upside potential of your investment portfolio, while increasing its risk factor

gen_profile.gen_profile_desc: Skilled professional with a steady income and cautious outlook, who wants to improve the standard of living.
life_stage_desc: Focusing on building a strong foundation

emergency_funds.title: Emergency Funds
emergency_funds.comment: Having an adequate liquidity buffer is an excellent downside protection strategy against situations like job loss, financial emergencies, etc.

health_insurance.title: Health Insurance
health_insurance.comment: A health insurance cover that’s commensurate with the costs of medical procedures and treatments ensures that your loved ones are financially at ease.

life_insurance.title: Life Insurance
life_insurance.comment: Inadequate life cover can be damaging for dependants if the policy owner leaves behind a large amount of liabilities, with only a few assets.

good_liabilities_to_total_assets.title: Good Liabilities-to-Total Assets
good_liabilities_to_total_assets.comment: It is advisable to use debt optimally when creating valuable assets for the future.

bad_liabilities_to_total_assets.title: Bad Liabilities-to-Total Assets
bad_liabilities_to_total_assets.comment: It is critical to keep unsecured or high-cost debt under control because, in comparison, a majority of assets yield lower returns.

expense_to_income.title: Expense-to-Income
expense_to_income.comment: Keeping expenses under control reduces the likelihood of encountering a cash flow problem.

good_liabilities_linked_emi_to_income.title: Good Liability Linked EMI-to-Income
good_liabilities_linked_emi_to_income.comment: Having only a few good EMIs (or none) may result in excessive interest payments, which is undesirable unless there are higher-return investment opportunities available.

bad_liabilities_linked_emi_to_income.title: Bad Liability Linked EMI-to-Income
bad_liabilities_linked_emi_to_income.comment: It is critical to manage bad debt repayment well in order to avoid paying too much interest on high-cost liabilities.

investments_to_income.title: Investments-to-Income
investments_to_income.comment: While regular and significant savings are necessary for a secure future, it's equally crucial to keep a balanced living and avoid making excessive sacrifices in the here and now.

equity.title: Equity
equity.comment: Keeping equity allocation low could potentially limit the long-term growth potential of a portfolio and may result in lower returns.

real_estate.title: Real Estate
real_estate.comment: A low real estate allocation misses out on a valuable way to diversify portfolio and generate consistent returns over time.

passive_income_assets.title: Passive Income Assets
passive_income_assets.comment: Keeping very low or no passive income assets may limit one's ability to generate consistent and reliable streams of income in the long term and increase vulnerability to financial risks.

debt.title: Debt
debt.comment: Unless there is a short-term financial objective associated with it, excessive exposure to debt instruments might reduce overall portfolio returns.

alternative_investments.title: Alternative Investments
alternative_investments.comment: Allocating some portion of the portfolio to alternative products provides diversification benefits.

comments1: *1 Finance score ranges from 0-100. The table above displays scores of the Direct-Growth plans of the respective schemes.
**Excess Annual Expense are estimates derived from the difference between expense ratios of regular and direct plans, and current value.
comments2: 100% of your MF investments are in Direct plans, which translates to lower expenses and higher returns.

0% of your equity MFs (by value) are high quality. Consider removing low/medium quality funds from your portfolio. Our equity MF featured list is available at the end of this report, and an evaluation of all equity MFs is available on our MF scoring and ranking page.

tax_deduction_exemption_table.tax_class: Life insurance premium, ELSS Mutual Funds, School fees, PPF, EPF, etc.
Additional interest deduction on home loan for house bought in 2016-17

action_of_this_year: Consider the National Pension Scheme for retirement planning, which provides tax advantages as well. Your contribution  up to Rs. 50,000 (as an employee) is deductible. Also, you can also opt for employer contribution, which is deductible up to 10% of your basic salary (around Rs. 2.48 lakhs in your case)
If you are paying health insurance premium for your parents, you can claim deduction of Rs. 50,000 (as they are senior citizen) for the same. This is over and above Rs. 25,000 for self and family.

As you have outstanding loan on a residential property, you can claim interest of the same as deduction against your salary income up to Rs. 2 lakhs. You can declare the same to your employer. This will reduce your TDS from salary.
Income considered (Rs. 89.56L) for tax calculations is based on Tax Computation shared

description: Unless the policy is linked to a financial goal, limit your losses by surrendering as the yield is generally low at 3 - 4 % p.a.

comments.title: Emergency Planning
desc: Purchase life cover of around ₹2.0-₹3.5Cr via term insurance to get adequately covered.
Get a health insurance cover of ₹10.0L-₹15.0L to ensure that you are sufficiently protected.
Reduce your liquid investments from ₹35.0L (₹15.0L in saving account and ₹20.0L in bank FDs) to ₹12.0L (equivalent to 6 months of your fixed expenses).
